abstract: bridgeport woman faces felony fraud charges .
article: bridgeport -- a bridgeport woman was recently accused of illegally collecting more $ 15,000 in unemployment compensation benefits . monica smalls , 38 , was arrested friday after an investigation into a complaint by the state department of labor . smalls is accused of collecting about $ 15,000 in unemployment benefits from july 2012 to september 2014 when investigators say she was working for a school transportation business , according to a release from the state department of labor . inspectors from the unemployment compensation fraud unit in the chief state 's attorney 's office arrested and charged her with larceny in the first degree by defrauding a public community and felony unemployment compensation fraud .

for the larceny charge , smalls faces one to 20 years in prison and/or up to a $ 15,000 fine . she faces one to five years in prison and/or up to a $ 5,000 fine for the unemployment compensation fraud charge . she was released on a $ 10,000 bond . she is scheduled to appear in new britain superior court on thursday .
